title: "Curse God and Die"
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Benton Murdoch Spruance [1904-1967], Philadelphia, PA; Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA [1]; gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, November 1951.

Notes:
[1]. Mrs. Beal purchased two sets of 5 lithographs comprising "The Book of Job" from the artist for $200 each. One set was for Carnegie Institute (see curatorial file for two payment acknowledgements, in October and November 1951.) 
[2]. The set of lithographs was accessioned on November 1, 1951.
